subject: Re: Compiling JUnit
msgSnippet: Ok. Here is whats happening. Junit has a samples directory under org/junit/samples. I modified the file called SimpleTest.java and tried to compile it using
messageBody:
Ok. Here is whats happening.

Junit has a samples directory under org/junit/samples. I modified the
file called SimpleTest.java and tried to compile it using javac
SimpleTest.java


The source file looks like the following:

package org.junit.samples;

import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
import junit.framework.JUnit4TestAdapter;
import org.junit.Before;
import org.junit.Test;

/**
* Some simple tests.
*
*/
public class SimpleTest {
protected int fValue1;
protected int fValue2;

@Before public void setUp() {
fValue1= 2;
fValue2= 3;
}

public static junit.framework.Test suite() {
return new JUnit4TestAdapter(SimpleTest.class);
}

@Test public void divideByZero() {
int zero= 1;
int result= 8/zero;
result++; // avoid warning for not using result
}
@Test public void testEquals() {
assertEquals(12, 12);
assertEquals(12L, 12L);
assertEquals(new Long(12), new Long(12));

assertEquals("Size", 12, 13);
assertEquals("Capacity", 12.0, 11.99, 0.0);
}

}

---------------------------------------------------------

The error that is:

C:\junit4.3.1\org\junit\samples>javac SimpleTest.java

SimpleTest.java:3: <identifier> expected
import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
^
SimpleTest.java:3: '.' expected
import static org.junit.Assert.assertEquals;
^
SimpleTest.java:16: illegal character: \64
@Before public void setUp() {
^
SimpleTest.java:22: <identifier> expected
return new JUnit4TestAdapter(SimpleTest.class);
^
SimpleTest.java:22: <identifier> expected
return new JUnit4TestAdapter(SimpleTest.class);
^
SimpleTest.java:22: '{' expected
return new JUnit4TestAdapter(SimpleTest.class);
^
SimpleTest.java:25: illegal character: \64
@Test public void divideByZero() {
^
SimpleTest.java:30: illegal character: \64
@Test public void testEquals() {
^
SimpleTest.java:38: <identifier> expected
^
9 errors

-----------------------------------------------------------

I hope this helps in diagnosing this problem.
Please let me know what do you think about this.

Thanks,
fs

> I am new to Junit and I would like to start using it. I started
> reading a little bit about it, and downloaded some code and I wanted
> to build my own test classes using annotations, but I could not
> compile them. Can someone explain to me my how to go about compiling
> junit classes? I am using junit 4.3.1 version, since it seems to be
> the latest one.
> What am i missing here????
>
>
> Thanks,
> fs
